page.title: 02 THE VILLAGES.
page.content: Denton has several old cottage properties around a triangular village green at its centre.Most of the cottages were originally built for employees of Castle Ashby estate but many are now privately owned. Three of these cottages are thatched with Norfolk reeds.In the village as a whole there are now only 5 thatched houses but older residents can remember as many as 24. Two large estates have more than doubled the population of Denton in the last 20 years. Hackleton does not have a central point but consists of serveral old stone houses (some quite large) built either side of the main road through the village. The new estates have developed behind these houses.A small number of houses are being erected in both places at the present time.
